abstract: After two years of research, the company said a plant that would convert natural gas to liquids would have cost more than $20 billion.
snippet: After two years of research, the company said a plant that would convert natural gas to liquids would have cost more than $20 billion.
lead_paragraph: Royal Dutch Shell said on Thursday that it would not build an immense gas-to-liquids plant on the Gulf Coast because of concerns over its cost. Shell had been studying the possibility of building a plant to take advantage of cheap shale gas in the United States for at least two years.

headline.main: Shell Opts Not to Build Plant on Gulf Coast, Citing Costs
headline.print_headline: Shell Opts Not to Build Plant On Gulf Coast, Citing Costs
